intro: Pleurothallis zumbae, commonly known as the Zumbá orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit, often found growing on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow, typically blooming during the rainy season. Its intricate floral structure and unique coloration make it a sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts. Pleurothallis zumbae is also noted for its delicate foliage, which contributes to its ornamental appeal.
